title: Stop allowing junglers to gank level 3 with full heath at the 2:25 minute mark.

replies.body: ward better, follow your jungler's pathing to help determine their jungler's pathing, and stop getting caught out.

Ok, I'm an early/mid game top laner versus a Nasus.  It's the 2:30 mark and the enemy jungler started bot side.  But I really don't want Nasus to be able to farm Q stacks especially this early so I need to harass.

What do I do?

Accept that "stop Nasus from getting stacks" is a meme-you'll never stop a good Nasus from stacking- and either roam and get other lanes ahead to finish the game early or figure out a way to stall past the mid game so that Basis can fall off.

Is it a early ganking jungler? Lee, J4, Poppy, Kha. get a ward in the edge of tri before 2:30. 2:30 roles around. that gives you vision in a spot most junglers will walk through on their way to you. and a path to escape should he come up from behind. Kill your opponent if you can. If you cant manipulate the minion wave to be in your favor. also remember. Your jungler is also up at 2:30. He is a mobile ward. If he is done his camps. odds are the enemy jungler is as well. If he is walking up to your top lane to try and find a gank in a nice frozen lane. odds are. so is the enemy jungler. You are now 2 early game powerhouses. vs 1 and susan.  If the enemy jungler is a farm type jungle or yi. force the enemy wave to push to you. and kill the laner.

I just ask because I mid main at an ok level and whenever I have to play top versus a hypercarry top laner whose style revolves around "get shut down early but scale hard" I tend to find the enemy jungler camping my lane.

I don't die, but it forces me off the minion wave.  Then the question is "why is there a 300 stack Nasus at 20 minutes?"

I wish there was another response than "their jungler prioritized babysitting top and you didn't, Mr. Jungler." 

In this way, lane phase is dictated by the choices of the enemy jungler and my jungler rather than the choices of enemy top and me as top.  The only choice I have is either attempt to escape a 2v1 or let him farm.

As A jungle main. 

I will babysit nasus because he is useless to me if he falls behind. And I expect the enemy jungler to camp. I like to play like a roaming support though. I never want to take kills, I give them to teammates. This being said. There is significantly less risk in ganking top and mid as an early jungle, then screwing up a gank into bot and feeding the adc even one kill. 

As a sion main. I actually generally tell my dear nasus to break out the lube, and get a pillow. Cause im probly gonna be farming as much as possible to reach 6. I will not gank his lane unless I am nearby and will be sure to save his life, or get a kill. My priority to is get cinderhulk and steamroll into bot lane with my ult. I don't care how well my top does, I dont care how well my mid does. Because building tank support sion jungle. If I get my bot lane ahead, NOBODY will be able to kill my carry again. 

Ofc I'll gank lanes. But its not like a level 3 scaling jungler is going to sit top non-stop unless you are already losing and are free gold, we got better shit to do. jungles to invade. Junglers to avoid, and if I know the enemy jungler will be camping top. I OWN the bot side jungle. 

But if you tp into lane. I am going to take the first chance I can. To FORCE you to go back or die, cause that gives my laner one hell of an edge.

Ward better? Mid has 1 ward, jungler can come from both directions. Top probably needed to ward the buff to avoid an invade. Botlane support warded the bush to manage poke and lane control better. The jungler warded river bush to avoid getting invaded. The adc...

Ok, so the adc could maybe ward the river bush. If they can do so safely( remember, if the jungler is there they are likely dead) and the state of the lane allows it. And they didn't ward the second bush (or first bush because wards last only a minute).
You should know which side to ward based on which side the jungler starts on if you're mid. OP is complaining from top lane where you basically have 1 priority spot to ward
there are 3, on champs like Reksai even 4 gankpaths for top, and the ward only has a 33% uptime
